qas.question: What was the biggest influence from the west on Ottoman literature?
During what time period was Ottoman literate most influenced by the west?

answers.text: the latter half of the 19th century

qas.question: During the Tanzimat what western influence could be seen?
The poetic tradition had its biggest influence on what Ottoman literary movements?
Romanticism, and Realism were two movements from the west that influenced the Ottoman literary scene, what was the third?

context: Due to historically close ties with France, <a0_0>French literature<a0_0/> came to constitute the major Western influence on Ottoman literature throughout <a1_0>the latter half of the 19th century<a1_0/>. As a result, many of the same movements prevalent in France during this period also had their Ottoman equivalents: in the developing Ottoman prose tradition, for instance, <a2_0>the influence of Romanticism<a2_0/> can be seen during the Tanzimat period, and that of the Realist and <a4_0>Naturalist<a4_0/> movements in subsequent periods; in the poetic tradition, on the other hand, it was the influence of <a3_0>the Symbolist and Parnassian movements<a3_0/> that became paramount.
